page.title: 11Villagers must own cars
page.content: About 92% of people own a car. On average they travel 155 miles per week in order to live comfortably. The average villager travels 73 miles per week just to go to work, one topped 500 miles, but he was a representative and, as 55% of workers commute, such mileage is reasonable. Each family will on average travel 27 miles to shop, which is esential if they are to secure relatively cheap, varied food. there is no entertainment on our 'D' block, and so on average people expect to travel 33 mile every week for fun. People felt that car ownership is essential in such an isolated rural area where only a very limited bus service to Sturminster Newton exists. The scattered nature of settlement often determines the use of a car just to visit friends.
